title: "wordl"

```{r}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)

# Define a list of words for the game
word_list <- c("apple", "banana", "orange", "grape", "kiwi", "peach", "pear")

# Select a random word from the list
word <- sample(word_list, 1)

# Function to check the guess and provide feedback
evaluate_guess <- function(guess, word) {
  if (guess == word) {
    return("Congratulations! You guessed the word!")
  }
  
  # Convert the word and guess to vectors of characters
  word_chars <- strsplit(word, "")[[1]]
  guess_chars <- strsplit(guess, "")[[1]]
  
  # Check for correct letters in the correct positions
  correct_positions <- sum(word_chars == guess_chars)
  
  # Check for correct letters in the wrong positions
  correct_letters <- sum(word_chars %in% guess_chars)
  correct_wrong_positions <- correct_letters - correct_positions
  
  # Construct feedback message
  feedback <- paste(
    "Correct letters in correct positions:", correct_positions,
    "\nCorrect letters in wrong positions:", correct_wrong_positions
  )
  
  return(feedback)
}

# Main game loop
cat("Welcome to Wordle!\n")
cat("Try to guess the word.\n")

guesses <- 0
max_guesses <- 5

while (guesses < max_guesses) {
  guess <- readline(prompt = "Enter your guess: ")
  
  if (nchar(guess) != nchar(word)) {
    cat("Please enter a word with the same number of characters as the secret word.\n")
    next
  }
  
  feedback <- evaluate_guess(guess, word)
  cat(feedback, "\n")
  
  guesses <- guesses + 1
  
  if (guess == word) {
    break
  }
}

if (guess == word) {
  cat("Congratulations! You guessed the word '", word, "' in", guesses, "guesses!\n", sep = "")
} else {
  cat("Sorry, you've run out of guesses. The word was '", word, "'. Better luck next time!\n", sep = "")
}

```
